meanings.definition: To lose water or moisture; become dry.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside in the sun all day, the soil became dehydrated.
meanings.sent2: The flowers dehydrated quickly in the hot summer weather.
meanings.sent3: The sponge felt dehydrated after soaking up all the spilled water.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project slowly dehydrated as time passed.
meanings.sent5: The desert landscape was so dehydrated that not even a single plant could survive.

meanings.definition: To remove water or moisture from (food) in order to preserve it.
meanings.sent1: The chef dehydrated the fruits to make them last longer.
meanings.sent2: Hikers often dehydrate their food before long trips to save weight.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut dehydrated the food before taking it to space.
meanings.sent4: The process of dehydrating meat is essential for making jerky.
meanings.sent5: To preserve the herbs, they decided to dehydrate them in the oven.

meanings.definition: Suffering from excessive loss of water from the body.
meanings.sent1: The hiker felt dehydrated after forgetting to bring water on the trail.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised the athlete to drink more water to avoid feeling dehydrated.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner joked that he felt like a dehydrated raisin after the race.
meanings.sent4: The plant looked dehydrated and wilted under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The desert tortoise appeared dehydrated and in need of water.
